Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Hut \Hut\, n. [OE. hotte; akin to D. hut, G. h["u]tte, OHG. hutta, Dan. hytte, Sw. hydda; and F. hutte, of G. origin; all akin to E. hide to conceal. See {Hude} to conceal.] A small house, hivel, or cabin; a mean lodge or dwelling; a slightly built or temporary structure. [1913 Webster]
Death comes on with equal footsteps To the hall and hut. --Bp. Coxe. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: hep \hep\ (h[e^]p), interj. A call used by drill instructors to count cadence during marching; used identically to {hut} and {hup}. [PJC]
hut n 1: temporary military shelter [syn: {army hut}, {field hut}] 2: small crude shelter used as a dwelling [syn: {hovel}, {hutch}, {shack}, {shanty}]
